com.soen6441.core

Class Play

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.soen6441.core.Play

  • public class Play
extends java.lang.Object

    Introduction

    Play is the like the center data and logic of the game.

    Play contains GridMap and some shared information like coins and life



    Tasks

    Tasks - Using the object

    General Idea

    Play is using the singleton design parttern.

    The Play is kind of semi single. which means once the instance has been created, it can be destroyed and created a new one. But there will be only zero / one object in the runtime

    To get the play object

    Use currentPlay() method to get the instance.

    To destory the play object

    When finished a play, like you quit from PlayingScene you should destory the Play object.

    Use destroy() method to destory the shared instance, so when someone call currentPlay() later, they will get a new one.



    Tasks - Managing the coins

    Getting and Setting the coins

    Use getCoins() and setCoins(int) to get and set the coins directly.

    If you want to increase or decrease the coins base on the logic, please use the following methods.

    To change the coins

    Use earnCoins(int) to increase the coins.

    Use spendCoins(int) to decrease the coins.

    Attention: Call getCoins() before call spendCoins(int) to check whether the coins is enough to spend

    Author:
    Zhe Zhao
